column4: hey just, i just got done resizing and growing my second hard drive.  Gparted reported succes, but now the drive is showing up as an unknown file system.  Any ideas?
did you actualy format it ?
no i didnt think i did, and ive used gparted a thousand times :X
it had about 42 gig on it prior and even reported everything as there, just in a 114gig space.. now it shows uknown
I mean ...   does that hdd have data on it thatyou need to keep ? try giving it a new format
sorta kinda if i can salvage it i need to
ok what fs was that hdd when you started out ?
and where do you get that the fs is not recognised now ?
fdisk -l reports its a Linux system though
have you tried mounting it ? might jsut be gparted that's goofing off
yeah it just hangs
reboot ?
yup did that too :\
what does  sudo blkid say ?
thats whats in my /etc/fstab too
make sure the uuid match
they do
try booting the live cd and mounting it, see if that helps , at the very least it might allow you to recover the data
i was thinking about that.  Ill give that a go in a little bit
but I recommend you prepare yourself for hte possibliltty that it's effed up
whats the easiest way to just to a fs check on the disk?
if it is ill try not to cry too much, i have some backups, there dated but i think i can manage
sudo fsck /dev/sd...
thanks.  Ill check out a live cd in a few and see if i can get the data back, if not ill wipe it
